chat_history.content: [START_SESSION]

Welcome back, Jade! This is our final session together, and I'm really looking forward to hearing how things went with your sleep routine and walking goals over the past week. Before we dive in, how are you feeling today?
im feeling good

That's great to hear! So let's talk about this past week. You had two goals: turning off screens at 11 and being in bed by 11:30 at least 3 days, and walking around your neighborhood for 30 minutes twice a week on Fridays and Saturdays. How did achieving your goals go this last week?
i achieved both
That's wonderful, Jade! I'm so proud of you for following through on both goals. What happened that helped you succeed this week?
i had time
Having time really made a difference for you. Now that you've achieved both goals, what changes have you noticed in how you feel or your energy levels?
i feel more energized

That's fantastic that you're feeling more energized! It sounds like the combination of better sleep and getting outside for walks is really working for you. As we move forward, what would you like to focus on for the next two weeks?
i want to keep the same goals and make them a long term thing

I love that you want to build on this momentum and make these habits stick long-term. So if I'm hearing you right, you want to continue with turning off screens at 11, being in bed by 11:30 three times a week, and walking 30 minutes twice a week on Fridays and Saturdays. Is that correct?
yes
Perfect. Before we finalize these as your ongoing goals, I'd like to check in on something. On a scale of 1-10, what was your stress level like this past week?
That's wonderful to hear your stress is so low. Now I'm curious, last time we met you mentioned these goals but shared they weren't fully achieved. What happened with your goals over the past week?
I said i achieved both?

You're absolutely right, and I apologize for the confusion. You did say you achieved both goals. That's fantastic. So you successfully turned off screens at 11 and got to bed by 11:30 three times, and you did your 30-minute walks on Friday and Saturday. How did it feel to accomplish both of those?
it felt fifilling

That's great to hear it felt fulfilling. Since you achieved both goals, would you like to keep working with these same goals, maybe adjusting them to challenge yourself a bit more, or would you prefer to set completely new goals for this week?
keep working on the same goals

Perfect. Since this is our final session together and the program ends after today, let's talk about how you'll continue these goals on your own moving forward. What do you think will be your biggest challenge in keeping up with turning off screens at 11, being in bed by 11:30 three times a week, and walking twice a week once our program is over?
i think just keeping it up

That makes sense. Keeping up momentum on your own can be tough. What's one thing you could put in place to help remind yourself or stay accountable after our program ends, like a calendar reminder, tracking in a journal, or maybe asking a friend or family member to support you?
i  think keeping up with rthe alarmd helps
That's a solid plan. Setting those alarms can really help keep you on track. On a scale of 1 to 10, how confident do you feel about continuing these goals on your own after our program ends today?

That's great confidence. Since this is our final session, I want to celebrate how far you've come over these four weeks. You set meaningful goals around sleep and walking, and you've built some good habits. What feels like your biggest win from working on these goals?
i think feeling more myself is definitely a win

That's a huge win. Feeling more like yourself again is what it's all about. As you move forward, what's one thing you'll take with you from our time together that you think will help you keep taking care of yourself?
i think to do things that make me feel good

That's a really powerful takeaway. Doing things that make you feel good is such a simple but important principle to guide your choices. How do you plan to remind yourself of that when life gets busy or stressful?
i think i might download a mindfulness app
A mindfulness app could be a helpful tool to keep you connected to that principle. Do you have any final questions or anything else you'd like to discuss before we wrap up?
no

It's been wonderful working with you over these past weeks, Jade. You've made real progress in prioritizing your wellbeing and figuring out what helps you feel like yourself. Keep doing those things that make you feel good, and I'm confident you'll continue moving in a positive direction. Wishing you all the best!
